La Ferrari SF90 - stagione 2019

Si alzano i veli della Ferrari f.1 2019
e il lustro italiano nel Mondo si riafferma.

Perch√® questa √® la scuderia pi√π famosa al Mondo,
√® il marchio di un mito della velocit√†,
√® il capitolo delle corse in macchina,
√® il cavallino rampante dentro ogni uomo di cultura.
Il panorama della stagione 2019 si giocher√† sul filo dei secondi e dei punti,
ma la forma della nostra livrea rossa √® tutta da scoprire;
e ancora una volta sar√† fascinosa, imbarazzante,
registrata perfettamente al nuovo che avanza e alla tecnologia insistente,
e l'innovazione sar√† unica e inimitabile.
La tradizione √® ispirazione, √® valore aggiunto nato da mani e menti emiliane,
lavoratori dotati di tanta passione per l'armonia di un motore acceso e velocissimo,
e la volont√† di essere la storia nella storia;
di aver costruito pagine di vita sportiva, di aver partecipato a tutti i campionati
del Mondo di formula 1 e di essere legati ad una generazione meccanica italiana.
La Ferrari, il cuore rosso Ferrari √® l'esempio vivente,
di una classe sportiva lunga e coerente,
fatta di ricerca e sviluppo costanti, ma saldamente stretta al suo passato glorioso,

comunque.

text: All this talk of end-plates on every F1 car.. What happens when the driver adjusts their front wheel cambers and the tyres are then expanded outward from the end plate? I've seen on every car the end-plate is directly flush in-line with the side ends of the tyres... Air wash will essentially be directed to the sides of the tyres effectively creating more slip and less traction as well as increased cooling effect of the rubber which we know they dont want, essentially they want tyres up to optimal temperatures. I know certain tracks most drivers use a increased camber setting in which the inside part of the tyres are getting the bulk of the traction. Anyway, just my observation..

text:
I think they did 3 things mainly:
1-reproducing an ouwash effect with neutral/negative wing to control airflow out of tyre squirt/turbulence.
2-the middle of the front part raises air from the wing to the sodepods while the central vortexes are heavily outwashed by the barge boards. This probably undercuts the need of a slim area underneath the sodepods which is used to channel the flow inside the lateral structure. That large structure also prevents the ouwash to come too early into the sides of the car.
3-pushing hard to let the outwashed air come into the coke bottle area more violently and orderly. Similar to red bull they pushed the tightness to an unbelievable level and all that air that comes back into the car should hit hard the diffuser with a lot of pressure.
Refines the concept of last year! It will be very interesting to see who will come on top!

text: What Merc dominance? Merc haven't been dominate since 2016. Ferrari probably had the better car in 2017 and they definitely did in 2018. Why do you care about who wins the championship so much anyway? That's inconsequential to the actual sport; there are over 20 races all with 20 positions to be decided and all you care about is who wins at the end of the year? That's just stupid. Throughout 2018, we never knew who was going to win the race out of Mercedes and Ferrari and even Red Bull at some tracks - Mercedes only ended up winning overall because Hamilton is a far better driver than Vettel and Mercedes made less mistakes than Ferrari - there wasn't any domincance though; Ferrari coud easily have won last year if they had a better driver and they hadn't made so many mistakes. It's not really Merc's dominance you want to be over - it's Ferrari and Vettel's incompetence.

text:
I'm a big Seb fan and a Brit. Thinking about it my friends who are into F1 are all Seb fans. He's actually very British in his mannerisms, sense of humour and obviously he speaks with in English English rather than Canadian/American English.

The only thing I would say is that the University of Sheffield built a software program that takes into account your record against ex team mates, ex rivals in the same series' and so on. So you don't get skewed results where someone who has only driven top tier cars comes out on top. Fangio was the best, Proxy, Senna,Alonso and Sterling Moss came in top 5. So going in a rudimentary style of that theory and using certain results from it, Seb lost a season to Danny Ricardo in the same car. Danny Lost a season (and the No.1 seat) to Max in the same car. So in theory over a season Max should be dominant over Seb. But we'll have to see how good the red bull is. Also interested to see SEB vs Charles LeClerc in the same car .

Jaiveer, only Toto and Hamilton said the Ferrari was faster, the stats do NOT agree with it, and yes, only Lewis fanboys were all over that myth.

As I keep repeating, Ferrari found a way to get a liitle extra from the dual batteries during qualifying, not the race, qualifying that put them on pole a couple of times. Benz whined like hell until the FIA took it off Ferrari, and the really annoying part was the FIA didn't completely understand how Ferrari were doing it, all their systems were within the bounds of the rules, unlike Benz outright cheating by getting more fuel into the engine via the oiling system, bypassing the fuel regulator.
